issue.title: Inconsistency between requirements for emplace between optional and variant

discussion.p: In : emplace (normal form) has a Requires that the construction works.
emplace (initializer_list form) has a SFINAE condition:

blockquote.p: Remarks: […] unless is_constructible_v<T, initializer_list<U>&, Args&&...> is true.

discussion.p: In : emplace (normal form) has a Requires that the construction works:
emplace (initializer_list form) has a SFINAE condition:

blockquote.p: Remarks: […] unless is_constructible_v<T, initializer_list<U>&, Args...> is true.

discussion.p: In : emplace (T, normal form) has a SFINAE condition:

blockquote.p: Remarks: […] unless is_constructible_v<T, Args...> is true, and T occurs exactly once in Types....

discussion.p: emplace (Idx, normal form) has a both a Requires and a SFINAE condition:

blockquote.p:
Requires: I < sizeof...(Types)
Remarks: […] unless is_constructible_v<T, Args...> is true, and T occurs exactly once in Types....

discussion.p: emplace (T, initializer_list form) has a SFINAE condition:

blockquote.p: Remarks: […] unless is_constructible_v<T, initializer_list<U>&, Args...> is true, and T occurs exactly once in Types....

discussion.p: emplace (Idx, initializer_list form) has a both a Requires and a SFINAE condition:

blockquote.p:
Requires: I < sizeof...(Types)
Remarks: […] unless is_constructible_v<T, Args...> is true, and T occurs exactly once in Types....

discussion.p:
Why the inconsistency? Should all the cases have a SFINAE requirement?
I see that variant has an additional requirement (T occurs exactly once in Types...), but that only agues that it must be a SFINAE condition — doesn't say that the other cases (any/variant) should not.
map/multimap/unordered_map/unordered_multimap have SFINAE'd versions of emplace that don't take initializer_lists, but they don't have any emplace versions that take ILs.
Suggested resolution:
Add SFINAE requirements to optional::emplace(Args&&... args) and any::emplace(Args&&... args);
During issue prioritization, people suggested that this might apply to any as well.
